title: Calories in a Sushi Roll
meta_description: Discover calories in a sushi roll, including macros like protein and carbs, plus per-roll nutrition facts and variations for different types.
assumptions: Standard California roll (8 pieces) with imitation crab, avocado, cucumber, seasoned rice, nori seaweed; no extra sauces.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by type of sushi roll, ingredients, rice portion, and preparation; check restaurant menus or labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard sushi roll like California has about 255 kcal, with 38 g carbs and 9 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Philadelphia roll with real cream cheese (vs. imitation crab)

faqs.q: How many calories in a California sushi roll?
faqs.a: About 255 kcal for an 8-piece standard California roll.

faqs.q: Are sushi rolls high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, due to seasoned rice and soy sauce; one roll can have ~730 mg sodium.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a sushi roll?
faqs.a: Around 9 g per standard roll, mainly from rice and fillings like crab.

faqs.q: Do all sushi rolls have the same calories?
faqs.a: Noâ€”veggie rolls are lower (~150 kcal), while tempura rolls can exceed 500 kcal.

faqs.q: How many carbs in a sushi roll?
faqs.a: Typically 38 g, mostly from sushi rice which contains sugar and vinegar.
